headline: Teach Them Their Inside World Early
body: If a child knows what their body is saying, they don’t have to fear it. That’s emotional safety in action.
prompt: What’s one way you could teach your child a new emotional or nervous system word this week?

headline: When They Can Name It, They Can Navigate It
body: Emotional vocabulary isn’t about being articulate—it’s about giving your child a map. So they don’t get lost inside.
prompt: What’s one new emotion word you could introduce this week—or use more often—to help your child navigate their inner world?

headline: You’re Not Just a Body—You’re a Signal
body: Every thought, breath, and feeling changes your field. Want to shift your day? Start with your frequency.
prompt: What practice this week could help shift your inner vibration—not to escape emotion, but to move through it?

headline: You Are Always Broadcasting—Even When You’re Silent
body: Your body speaks in tone, pace, posture, and presence. Tune your frequency, and your life starts to align.
prompt: What state has your nervous system been broadcasting lately—and what shift might it be asking for?

headline: You Are Made of Vibration—Heal With It
body: You don’t just think and feel. You hum. You resonate. And your healing starts at the frequency of safety.
prompt: What vibration-based practice or sound could you bring into your week to soften your system?

headline: You’re a Resonant Being—Tune Gently
body: Your body is sound-sensitive. Sometimes healing is less about what you think and more about what you hear and feel.
prompt: What sound could you bring into your space this week that helps shift your nervous system into safety?
